name: Roy Tang
text: Kaya ako nanghihinayang kasi I actually didn't buy one of the cheap generic mice this time. It's a Logitech G302. Not super expensive (mga 1800 ko ata nakuha), but I'm disappointed because it lasted less than a year. I don't have the manual dexterity to attempt to repair something with small parts myself

source_obj.text: Kaya ako nanghihinayang kasi I actually didn't buy one of the cheap generic mice this time. It's a Logitech G302. Not super expensive (mga 1800 ko ata nakuha), but I'm disappointed because it lasted less than a year. I don't have the manual dexterity to attempt to repair something with small parts myself

replies.text: try looking for the Dragon War Thor G9 sa Data Blitz. Mga 750 lang ata, comes with a mousepad pa. been using it since 2013, no problems.  :)
the spring mechanism of the switch is reaaaally small, haha. taking it out is easy, putting it back in is the challenge.
Currently using a Dragon War mouse. Over a year old and still doing awesome.

even if you replace it you need to take a switch from a working mouse. yung dragonwar sa datablitz is hit or miss. meron ako dragonwar na working na for 4 years. meron din ako binili nasira in 3 months.
